page.title: 04CONTINUED
page.content: The sheep are fed on grass in the summer and hay and cake in the winter. Other animals include two goats whose milk is used for drinking by animals and humans. There are two dogs, both sheep dogs. The youngest one is being trained and brings in the cows. There are five cats, two horses and poultry whose eggs are sold. The farm has eleven out buildings which are used for storing hay, silage, cake, straw, machinery, housing the cows and calves and for milking. A typical day would be to rise at 5.00am, bring in the cows and milk them and finish by 8.00am. Mr.Shuttleworth would then have breakfast and work in the fields with the sheep or cattle. At 12.00pm, he will have an hours lunch break and then work outside again spreading fertilizer or slurry or roll the fields. (CONT.)
